taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;subfamily amygdaloideae;tribe gillenieae;genus photinia;species davidiana;variety davidiana

bio:treatment.description: Plants 10–80 dm. Leaves persistent; petiole 12–20 mm, pilose, gradually glabrescent; blade elliptic to oblong or oblong-lanceolate, (3–)5–12 × 2–4.5 cm, coriaceous, base rounded to cuneate, margins entire, lateral veins 8–16 pairs, inconspicuous, apex acute or abruptly pointed, surfaces villous along abaxial midvein, otherwise glabrous. Inflorescences <with 8 laterals of 1st order>, 5–10 cm diam., <pendulous in fruit>. Pedicels without lenticels. Flowers 5–10 mm diam.; petals suborbiculate, 4–7 mm, glabrous.
bird-sown weed in thickets open or disturbed forests beaches rarely epiphytic

verbatim.text: Flowering Mar–Jun; fruiting Nov–Apr. Bird-sown weed in thickets, open or disturbed forests, beaches, rarely epiphytic; 0–150 m; introduced, Wash.; Asia (China, Malaysia, North Vietnam, Taiwan); introduced also in Europe, Pacific Islands (Hawaii, New Zealand).

parsed.habitat: Bird-sown weed in thickets, open or disturbed forests, beaches, rarely epiphytic;
parsed.distribution: introduced, Wash.; Asia (China, Malaysia, North Vietnam, Taiwan); introduced also in Europe, Pacific Islands (Hawaii, New Zealand).
